turns.content: Recommend some must-try street food in Bangkok.

1. Pad Thai - stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, beansprouts, egg, and peanuts.

2. Som Tam - spicy green papaya salad made with fish sauce, lime juice, garlic, chili and green beans.

3. Sate - grilled skewered meat such as chicken, beef, or pork served with peanut sauce.

4. Mango Sticky Rice - sweet dessert made with glutinous rice, coconut milk, and fresh mango.

5. Grilled seafood - fresh seafood such as prawns, squid, and fish grilled to perfection.

6. Khanom Buang - Thai-style crepes filled with coconut cream and shredded coconut.

7. Roti - crispy and flaky pancakes served plain or filled with banana, egg, and condensed milk.

8. Khao Man Gai - poached chicken and rice dish served with spicy chili sauce and ginger sauce.

9. Moo Ping - grilled pork skewers marinated in garlic, soy sauce, and sugar.

10. Bamee GOP - egg noodles served with minced pork, mushrooms, garlic, and soy sauce.
Wow, those all sound amazing! Any specific places you recommend for trying these street foods?

I don't have any personal recommendations. however, here are some popular areas in bangkok where you can find street food:

1. chinatown (yaowarat) - a haven for street food lovers offering a variety of chinese and thai food.

2. sukhumvit soi 38 - a popular street food spot for authentic thai cuisine including pad thai and mango sticky rice.

3. chatuchak weekend market - a huge market with a variety of street food options including grilled seafood, noodles, and thai desserts.

4. victory monument - a hub of street food stalls with local specialties such as boat noodles and grilled chicken.

5. silom soi 20 - famous for its grilled meats, seafood, and thai desserts.
I can't wait to try them out when I visit Bangkok next month!
I'm glad i could help! bangkok is known for its vibrant street food scene, and i'm sure you'll have an amazing food experience. enjoy your trip!
Hey, do you know if any of these street food places have vegetarian options?

Yes, most street food places in Bangkok offer vegetarian options. Some common vegetarian dishes include:

1. Pad Thai Jay - a vegetarian version of Pad Thai made with tofu or mushrooms instead of meat.

2. Som Tam Jay - a vegetarian version of Som Tam made without fish sauce, with peanuts as the protein source.

3. Khao Soi Jay - a vegetarian version of Khao Soi made with vegetables or tofu instead of chicken.

4. Khanom Buang Jay - a vegetarian version of Khanom Buang made without any filling that contains meat.

5. Roti Jay - a vegetarian version of Roti made with banana, condensed milk, and sugar.

Be sure to let the street food vendors know that you're looking for vegetarian options, and they'll be happy to assist you.
I always struggle to find good vegetarian options when I travel. Can't wait to try the Pad Thai Jay and Khanom Buang Jay in Bangkok!

Thailand is famous for its delicious vegetarian food, so you'll have plenty of options to choose from. Don't forget to try the various fresh fruits available at the stalls, such as mangoes, papayas, and guavas. They make excellent refreshing snacks on a hot day!
